Package edu.handong.arise

Class ConnectSix

java.lang.Object
edu.handong.arise.ConnectSix
public class ConnectSix
extends java.lang.Object

  • Field Details

    • redStones

      public java.lang.String redStones
      The String that contains the positions of the red stones. The positions will be separated by the delimiter ":".

  • Constructor Details

    • ConnectSix

      public ConnectSix​(java.lang.String ip, int port, java.lang.String color) throws ConnSixException
      Creates an instance of the class ConnectSix and connects to the platform. When success, the field 'redStones' will contain the location of the red stones. If there is no red stones, the field will be null value.
      Parameters:
      ip - String that contains the ip information. For example, "127.0.0.1".
      port - Integer that contains the port number information. For example, 8080.
      color - String that contains the stone color that the client will be using. For example, "White".
      Throws:
      ConnSixException - Throws an exception that happens when the network connection fail.

  • Method Details

    • letsConnect

      public java.lang.String letsConnect​(java.lang.String ip, int port, java.lang.String color) throws ConnSixException
      Connects to the platform and gets the red stones' locations from the platform
      Parameters:
      ip - String that contains the ip information
      port - Integer that contains the port number information
      color - String that contains the stone color that the client will be using.
      Returns:
      The String with the location of the red stones. The locations will be separated with the delimiter ':'. For example, "A01:K11"
      Throws:
      ConnSixException - Throws an exception that happens when the network connection fail.

    • drawAndRead

      public java.lang.String drawAndRead​(java.lang.String draw) throws ConnSixException
      Sends the location of the user's next move to the platform and receives the location of the opponent's move. The first move of black should be "K10" and the first move of white should be "", an empty String.
      Parameters:
      draw - The location where the user will put their stone. The locations will be separated with the delimiter ':'.
      Returns:
      The String that contains the location of the opponent's move. The locations will be separated with the delimiter ':'. If the game is over, the return String will contain "WIN" or "LOSE".
      Throws:
      ConnSixException - Throws an exception that happens when the network connection fail.

    • getBoard

      public java.lang.String getBoard​(java.lang.String position)
      Returns the current state of the location which can be empty, white, black or red.
      Parameters:
      position - the location of the state that the user is curious about.
      Returns:
      A String that can be "EMPTY", "WHITE", "BLACK" or "RED" according to the state of the position.
